label: Mechanical Engineering
description:
Mechanical engineering is the discipline that applies engineering, physics, and materials science principles to design, analyze, manufacture, and maintain mechanical systems.

Prerequisites: Understanding of basic physics principles, Knowledge of mathematics (algebra, calculus), Familiarity with material science concepts

Relevant resources: https://www.asme.org/, https://www.engineersedge.com/

Related topics: Materials Science, Thermodynamics

label: Cybersecurity Engineering
description:
Cybersecurity Engineering involves protecting computer systems, networks, and data from cyber threats, attacks, and unauthorized access through the application of technologies, processes, and practices.

Prerequisites: Understanding of basic computer science principles, Proficiency in programming languages (e.g., Python, C, C++), Familiarity with operating systems concepts

Relevant resources: https://www.isc2.org/, https://www.cybrary.it/

Related topics: Computer Science, Programming Languages
